text: Ned Jarrett (born October 12, 1932) is a retired race car driver and two-time NASCAR Grand National Series champion. He was born in Conover, North Carolina. He was best known for his calm attitude and he became known as "Gentleman Ned Jarrett".http://www.thatsracin.com/2011/05/20/62988/ned-jarrett.html He is the father of former drivers Glenn Jarrett and Dale Jarrett and grandfather of Jason Jarrett. Jarrett was added into the 2011 class of the NASCAR Hall of Fame on May 18 2011. ==References== ==Other websites== *Drivers statistics at racing-reference.info *International Motorsports Hall of Fame *Oceanside Rotary Club of Daytona Beach Hall of Fame *Transcript of Jarrett's July 4, 1984 interview of President Ronald Reagan on MRN Radio *Talladega Walk of Fame *Account of the 1965 Southern 500 *Biography Category:Living people Category:1932 births Category:NASCAR drivers Category:Sportspeople from North Carolina
title: Ned Jarrett
